ygData.subject: New blog, adaptive NN, online-learning

X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=234577593; y=4KIsnLemcKklnCjcjv0tW3CZXGtWs3gC98AuOliMEMB1AT1de_N-DOE0nOosPRydkItV-9bkMw

Hi all,

I've just started a Ph.D. with a topic around neuroevolution, onli=
ne-learning, adaptive NNs (via synaptic plasticity and/or similar). In my f=
everish excitement I thought it would be a good idea to start a blog on que=
stions and issues I come across, in the hope that other active researchers =
will want to comment on and perhaps even start a bit of dialogue about them=
 (like this mailing list but more public). I know another Ph.D. candidate w=
ho keeps a similar blog (totally different research area, though) and it's =
working out great for her, so it didn't seem like a completely hopeless ide=
a...

I know some of you are interested in the evolution of adaptive NNs, I=
 read your articles as soon as they were posted to this group! :) I also en=
visage using NEAT and variants in the research (I did a study of some of th=
e properties of HyperNEAT for my Honours year a year or so ago). It's at ht=
tp://ojcoleman.com. The first post is mostly background info (I hope I didn=
't get anything too wrong, let me know if you think I did!) and what the re=
search is about, but it also explains why I think the proposed approach is =
a good idea which might provide some good controversy points (maybe not so =
much among this crowd, however).

I googled around and couldn't find all th=
at many relevant blogs. Do any of you keep a similar blog or know of any? I=
 could mostly only find generic newsy AI ones.

Cheers,
Oliver
